subject: Location strategy config shouldn't be ristricted

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm confused by this patch, could you please explain?

There are two parts to using a location strategy: (1) having the module present in the correct place, and (2) setting the config value.  It is possible for an operator to do (2) and forget to do (1).  If that happens, we want an exception to occur so that the operator knows something is wrong.  That's what this test is testing.  Could you explain a bit more why you want to remove it, and what other test(s) we have covering this scenario?

Thanks!

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

So,
do I understand correctly that this is the only test that fails with enforce_type = True?

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

So based on my understanding, it's not necessary to add those negative test cases since oslo.config will enforce that. That makes sense for me. Thanks for working on this.

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

@gcb: thanks for the clear explanation.

I'm not going to block this change, but I do think this points out a problem.

If I understand the location_strategy feature correctly, it's designed to allow an operator to implement and deploy a custom strategy and then control which strategy is used via the configuration option.  If the configuration option only allows the two enumerated choices, then this feature doesn't work.  So I suggest that instead of removing this test, the configuration option needs to be re-defined so that oslo_config is not restricting the choices.

In other words, I think that in fixing the bug you're working on, you came across a different bug in the way Glance is defining this particular configuration option.

The "further work" this patch needs is (1) for someone more familiar than I am with the location_strategy feature to verify my interpretation of how it's supposed to work, and (2) if I'm correct, create a bug so that we remember to fix it.

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I think Brian's comment is a valid question. And I just did some investigation, even the method verify_location_strategy(), which is not used anywhere. The idea of location strategy is allowing cloud provider can add a customized location strategy. That said, no code change should be involved. As Brian pointed out, seems it's not true for this case. I have opened bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1598282 to track this. Besides, I'm working on https://review.openstack.org/268865 which is a new location strategy, so it could be good test case. Thanks.

Patch Set 4:

OK, so we need remove parameter choices from config option location_strategy, I have been fixing violations in consuming projects when set_override set paramter enforce_type with True by default[1].

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328692/
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Looks like Fei Long is working on this concurrently:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336761/

I left a comment on his patch asking him to file a bug outlining the fix for this.  Once he does that, please mark this patch as a partial fix for the new bug.

Thanks for your patience!

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hi ChangBo, I had a discussion with Brian and Nikhil about this at last weekend and we agreed to address this bug completely. That said, except removing the restriction, we also need to make sure cloud admin/operator will get an error when start glance-api if the location strategy is invalid. So I'm combining your change and mine into one patch if you don't mind(I have added you as co-author), see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336761 Please let me know if you have any question. Thanks.
Abandoned
